I'm Brandon, I was born and raised in North Carolina. I currently live in North Carolina with my parents until I finish school this spring, I also work. I love skinny-leg Jeans, V-Necks and Toms. Some things I do enjoy doing is cook of course, I love to travel and boat rides. Something special about me is that I am such a neat-freak and a perfectionist in organization, I will strip and organize a closet in a heartbeat! I am a TRUE definition of a Southern Belle. For instance, if I had a man, I would live to love and serve him like the King he was in my life. I'd cook for him, do his laundry, iron his clothes, makes sure he came home to nicely, cooked meal and much more. So yeah, I guess I would be considered "wifey material".

Most of all, just truthful. Now I'll be the first to admit that I love a man that loves to be in control and take charge. I love a man that wants to be the man in the relationship and wants be to be his "woman" in the relationship. I like men that know things about cars, a guy that's into sports is kind of hot too, although I'm not into sports. 
I think I'm very vulnerable and lonely at the moment, I really just don't know what it feels like to actually have someone really love me, other than my family. I've been gay my entire life and you would think by me being in my mid-twenties that I've experienced love, break ups and stuff like that but I haven't. I always find myself being the chaser and the funny thing is that I've always chased after those that never wanted me back. Isn't that something? Nobody had ever chased after me and I use to always wonder if I was ugly. It sucks to always wonder if you matter or if you'll every matter. But NO more will I do such a thing, I can't keep beating myself down about it. I know there's a man out there for that will love me, protect me. I know it's very common for men to cheat but I know good and darn well that not all men are cheaters and liars, they're a few good men left in the world.
All I've always dreamed of having a beautiful family of my own someday such as a handsome husband, for daughters and a dog named Peggy lol. Seriously, I've just always pictured the picket white fence and a happy, loving family. I've always seen me and my soulmate taking vacations, loading up the car to go on camping retreats with our friends, going riding in the car at night just to see the night life downtown, or just us cruising to go grab a bite to eat so we can get back home and find a good movie to watch. I've always pictured myself doing laundry and spring cleaning the house while my man be outside on the porch grilling or smoking up the kitchen burning the food claiming that he's cooking it cajun style" lol yeah right, I wish I could have those special memories where you'll be in the living room watching the NFL while I'll be on the phone in the kitchen cooking dinner and talking about the sales at Target. Or memories of me holding on for my dear life in the car due to road rage of the Saturday morning traffic, as we go visit your parents for brunch. Or what about the special memories of me going to refrigerator to get my Reeces Peanut Butter cup only to find out that it's not there because you ate it after you told me you didn't like Reeces, that you liked snickers instead. Or the memory of me seeing you wash your car out front as I snuck around back of the house to throw water balloons at you and run back in the house and lock the door so you wouldn't get me back.
I'm not going to go on and on but those are just examples of happiness that I've always wanted, nothing much, just a happy, healthy relationship with someone that I love and that loves me for who I am. I would LOVE to meet someone around my age but guys around my age seem to be so immature. They seem to use the term "hookup" in a totally different way than I do. They'd rather hookup with people in a adult bookstore or in a bedroom rather than hookup with hookup with people in a Restaurant over a nice conversation about current events, it's very sad. I mean yes don't get me wrong, we're human and have needs of course I get that but everything doesn't have to be about sex, someone with a little professionalism would be nice. So there you have it, that should just sum up of what I'm looking for in a man, not just a man, but a real man. Thanks for reading and may God bless you all! XOXO.

title: This is a shot in the dark
text:
Hi, there,

I'm 28, employed, educated, non-insane, and looking to possibly date a solid guy around my age. Cross-posting this from a dating to CL is more of an experience than anything else. Hopefully, it doesn't end in my getting stabbed.

My self-summary:

I realized I was bi a little late in life (no, i wasn't just closeted). I didn't consider guys as a viable option because dating & sleeping with women was always there and a "lifestyle" I preferred. Plus, beyond hookups, the guys I've been romantically interested in have always been straight. I'm now single and looking to change that because, why not?

I'm not too interested in the gay scene, though I don't discriminate against those who are. I'm just not looking for a hand-holder to drag night at the Cockpit or what have you. I've glimpsed enough of that scene and it's not mine. "Straight" clubs aren't either; not a club guy.

I'm long-term relationship oriented, ideally, and the kind of guy that wants something good to come home to some day. I don't really feel like I need to be special or unique to feel like I'm worth something. Posting 10 selfies of yourself a day and counting the likes sounds exhausting to me.

What I'm doing with my life:

- Editor by day and writer by late nights with a few cups of coffee. Currently working on a novel after a pretty middling collection of short stories.

- Imminent dog owner. I realize that it's a commitment in the city, so I'm planning it carefully. Lots of park walks in my future.

- Education-wise, I have an undergraduate degree in Sociology & Econ from Columbia and a Masters in Writing.

- I've lived in Montreal, Toronto, Austin, New York.

- Huge TV and movie buff, which is what I studied and hope to one day work in. Have a dream and loose business plans for my own production studio one day. An MBA might be in order first.

"Misc."

My music preferences are all over the place, and I'm the type that gets infatuated with a song and plays it a hundred times before I get sick of it and never listen again.

Not a vegetarian, but try to eat healthy at least half the time. Burger and fries when I don't. I love sushi and Indian. I order Seamless way too much and am tying to become a better cook beyond 'omelet' and 'keylime pie' which is a strange portfolio.

Not a buff gym-rat. More of a zone-out-on-the-treadmill-4-times-a-week type on that front. I like running but currently, I only go to the gym out of shallow necessity. I'm trying to engage in more diverse activities on that front. Muy Thai classes is kicking my ass a few times a month and I want to take up wall-climbing.

"On a typical Friday night I am"

I usually spend Friday nights having dinner with a small group of friend. I'm never too dissapointed about staying in and watching Netflix either, to be honest.

"The most private thing I'm willing to admit:"

- Even with a healthy network of friends and acquaintances, and normal amount of sex, the city gets very lonely sometimes. It feels like all dating site profiles are built on hiding that fact with as many pictures of other people as possible.

- I also want a family one day... When I'm a grown-up. Not super sure what that will look like, or when, but there you go.

"You should message me if:"

- You're sane and sweet. I hate to say "masculine" because I'm not some lumberjack myself but I've never been attracted to effeminate guys. Just being honest. Hopefully, you're just genuine, grounded, and know who you are.

- I'm not too into the types of guys who are too focused on what's trendy and how to be unique as a way of coping with their own insecurity. I don't want to be (or be with) someone who lives their life as a reality show no one is watching.

- Sexually, versatile, but not looking to hook up. There are like 5 apps for that. Unfortunately, there's not one for grabbing a beer.

Again, this is an experience. If this isn't for you, don't message me.

All the best,

Hello,

I posted an ad mainly because I'm at a point in my life where I'm ready to settle down and find true love. So about me, well I guess you can tell from my pictures that I'm obviously feminine and yeah, you guessed it right because I am. I'm not overboard with it but If I don't have my lip gloss, eye shadow, I'm not stepping out the house. I carry myself in a very flamboyant, stylish, sexy but classy manner if I must say. I love skinny-leg Jeans, V-Necks and Toms. Some things I do enjoy doing is cook of course, I love to travel and boat rides. Something special about me is that I am such a neat-freak and a perfectionist in organization, I will strip and organize a closet in a heartbeat! I am a TRUE definition of a Southern Belle. For instance, if I had a man, I would live to love and serve him like the King he was in my life. I'd cook for him, do his laundry, iron his clothes, makes sure he came home to nicely, cooked meal and much more. So yeah, I guess I would be considered "wifey material". 
What kind of guys am I attracted to? Well, I'm attracted to a Gentleman, someone that's very masculine, under 50, tall, protective, territorial, loving, caring, and passionate. Most of all, just truthful. Now I'll be the first to admit that I love a man that loves to be in control and take charge. I love a man that wants to be the man in the relationship and wants be to be his "woman" in the relationship. I like men that know things about cars, a guy that's into sports is kind of hot too, although I'm not into sports. 
I think I'm very vulnerable and lonely at the moment, I really just don't know what it feels like to actually have someone really love me, other than my family. I've been gay my entire life and you would think by me being in my mid-twenties that I've experienced love, break ups and stuff like that but I haven't. I always find myself being the chaser and the funny thing is that I've always chased after those that never wanted me back. Isn't that something? Nobody had ever chased after me and I use to always wonder if I was ugly. It sucks to always wonder if you matter or if you'll every matter. But NO more will I do such a thing, I can't keep beating myself down about it. I know there's a man out there for that will love me, protect me. I know it's very common for men to cheat but I know good and darn well that not all men are cheaters and liars, they're a few good men left in the world.
All I've always dreamed of having a beautiful family of my own someday such as a handsome husband, for daughters and a dog named Peggy lol. Seriously, I've just always pictured the picket white fence and a happy, loving family. I've always seen me and my soulmate taking vacations, loading up the car to go on camping retreats with our friends, going riding in the car at night just to see the night life downtown, or just us cruising to go grab a bite to eat so we can get back home and find a good movie to watch. I've always pictured myself doing laundry and spring cleaning the house while my man be outside on the porch grilling or smoking up the kitchen burning the food claiming that he's cooking it cajun style" lol yeah right, I wish I could have those special memories where you'll be in the living room watching the NFL while I'll be on the phone in the kitchen cooking dinner and talking about the sales at Target. Or funny memories of me getting up in the middle of the night to go pee with the bathroom light off and when I sit down to pee, all I feel is something wet from where you've peed all on the toilet seat (pet peev) but I'd still love you anyway. Or memories of me holding on for my dear life in the car due to road rage of the Saturday morning traffic, as we go visit your parents for brunch. Or what about the special memories of me going to refrigerator to get my Reeces Peanut Butter cup only to find out that it's not there because you ate it after you told me you didn't like Reeces, that you liked snickers instead. Or the memory of me seeing you wash your car out front as I snuck around back of the house to throw water balloons at you and run back in the house and lock the door so you wouldn't get me back.
I'm not going to go on and on but those are just examples of happiness that I've always wanted, nothing much, just a happy, healthy relationship with someone that I love and that loves me for who I am. I would LOVE to meet someone around my age but guys around my age seem to be so immature. They seem to use the term "hookup" in a totally different way than I do. They'd rather hookup with people in a adult bookstore or in a bedroom rather than hookup with hookup with people in a Restaurant over a nice conversation about current events, it's very sad. I mean yes don't get me wrong, we're human and have needs of course I get that but everything doesn't have to be about sex, someone with a little professionalism would be nice. That's all I'm saying. 

So there you have it, that should just sum up of what I'm looking for in a man, not just a man, but a real man. Thanks for reading and may God bless you all! XOXO.

text:

I am (I think, and if I do say so myself), a very nice person, honest, sincere, and loyal. Life has had its bumps along the way, and at 60, I find myself alone, without a whole lot of money, and I would like to find a partner. I never thought I would be posting a CL ad but here it goes.

I use my mouth alot - I talk too much, I eat too much, and, well you can help with the other stuff. 
I am a great cook and a lousy housekeeper. I spend too much time indoors and would like to be out more. I like the woods over the beach. I would rather have root canal without anesthesia than sit through the Oscars. Although I am out to everyone in my life who matters, I am not at all into the "gay scene".

My ideal partner is (none of these are absolute requirements except the kissing and cuddling part, and they are not listed in any particular order.) :

A caucasian (white) male between the ages of 45 and 70.
very masculine demeanor, but genuine, not Mary Muscles with leather chaps.
a working man (currently unemployed or retired is o.k.)
comfortable with his sexuality.
friendly and respectful to all.
religious or spiritually oriented, or a tolerant atheist.
a nature lover.
an animal lover.
a guy who can fix things and maybe who can teach me those skills as well.
a kisser and a cuddler (required).
a good listener.
SINGLE and AVAILABLE for building a relationship. (This does not mean that you are in a "long term but sexless relationship" or that you and Evelyn are getting a divorce as soon as you find a new job.)
Horny as Hell with a strong libido, at the *top* of his game but with some versatility. I am NOT looking for a total bottom, or anyone who wants to be "submissive" or who wants a "daddy". 
A non-drug user and a non-alcoholic. (A few beers now and then is fine.)
Generous of spirit.
Someone who doesn't complain about everything. (I dated a NYPD officer once. He was great in many ways, but incessantly harping about his pension. Have a nice life, Sarge.)
Patient.
Vegetarians are nice, but not essential. (I eat very little meat, but I'm not a vegetarian either.)

I really don't care about your bank account, your house in the Bahamas, your stock portfolio, how often you go to the gym, or how many countries you have been to. On the other hand, I might care about the cat you rescued and gave to your niece, the last book you read, the cabin you are building in the Adirondacks, your French lessons, which days you work in the soup kitchen, or what the priest/minister/rabbi's sermon was about.

I don't mind if you are a cigarette smoker, although not in my house, please.

As for looks, etc., I am attracted to faces, but the faces I am attracted to are not necessarily those that others find classically handsome, and I find that most men have something to offer. So if you don't look like George Clooney, don't despair. On the other hand, if you do look like G.C., don't pass me up either! 

I am not particularly attracted to tattoos (they don't turn me off or on - they're just there, and I would never have one). Piercings in odd places DO turn me off, as does "manscaping" and stuff like leather harnesses, etc. Foreskins are nice. I am [literally] allergic to men's cologne.

title: This is another shot in the dark.
text:
Hi, I'm 28, employed, educated, non-insane, and looking to date a solid guy around my age. Cross-posting this from OkCupid to CL is more of an experience than anything else. The last time I posted this I got a nice pen pal which led to some nice emails but nothing more. (Also, a slew of 3-5 word replies but that's Craigslist for you!)

My self-summary:

I'd like to think I'm a normal and friendly guy (looking for a connection on Craigslist, but, y'know, not an axe murderer.) I'm not too interested in the gay scene, though I don't discriminate against those who are. I'm just not looking for a hand-holder to drag night at the Cockpit or what have you. I've glimpsed enough of that scene and it's not mine. "Straight" clubs aren't either; not a club guy.

I'm long-term relationship oriented, ideally, and the kind of guy that wants something good to come home to some day. I don't really feel like I need to be special or unique to feel like I'm worth something. Posting 10 selfies of yourself a day and counting the likes sounds exhausting to me.

What I'm doing with my life:

- Associate Editor by day, teacher by other days (out of love more than monetary requirement), and finally, writer by latenights with a few cups of coffee. Currently working on a novel after a pretty middling collection of short stories.

- Imminent dog owner. I realize that it's a commitment in the city, so I'm planning it carefully. Lots of park walks in my future.

- Education-wise, I have an undergraduate degree in Sociology & Econ from Columbia and a Masters in Writing.

- I've lived in Montreal, Toronto, Austin, New York.

- Huge TV and movie buff, which is what I studied and hope to one day work in. Have a dream and loose business plans for my own production studio one day. An MBA might be in order first.

"Misc."

My music preferences are all over the place, and I'm the type that gets infatuated with a song and plays it a hundred times before I get sick of it and never listen again.

Not a vegetarian, but try to eat healthy at least half the time. Burger and fries when I don't. I love sushi and Indian. I order Seamless way too much and am tying to become a better cook beyond 'omelet' and 'keylime pie' which is a strange portfolio.

Not a buff gym-rat. More of a zone-out-on-the-treadmill-4-times-a-week type on that front. I like running but currently, I only go to the gym out of shallow necessity. I'm trying to engage in more diverse activities on that front. Muy Thai classes is kicking my ass a few times a month and I want to take up wall-climbing.

"On a typical Friday night I am"

I usually spend Friday nights having dinner with a small group of friend. I'm never too dissapointed about staying in and watching Netflix either, to be honest.

"The most private thing I'm willing to admit:"

- Even with a healthy network of friends and acquaintances, and normal amount of sex, the city gets very lonely sometimes. It feels like all dating site profiles are built on hiding that fact with as many pictures of other people as possible.

- I also want a family one day... When I'm a grown-up. Not super sure what that will look like, or when, but there you go.

"You should message me if:"

- You're sane and sweet. I hate to say "masculine" because I'm not some lumberjack myself but I've never been attracted to effeminate guys. Just being honest. Hopefully, you're just genuine, grounded, and know who you are.

- I'm not too into the types of guys who are too focused on what's trendy and how to be unique as a way of coping with their own insecurity. I don't want to be (or be with) someone who lives their life as a reality show no one is watching.

- Sexually, versatile, but not looking to hook up. There are like 5 apps for that. Unfortunately, there's not one for grabbing a beer.

Again, this is an experience. If this isn't for you, don't message me.

All the best,

When it comes to sex, the big surprise in study after study is that women want it as frequently as men do. OK, "want" might be too strong a word.

Certainly women don't think of sex as often as men do, and there's a reason that the stereotype of a man asking and a woman demurring exists. And yes, it remains true that men want casual sex more than women do. One survey actually had attractive research assistants approach members of the opposite sex and proposition them for sex. A full 75 percent of men agreed while exactly zero women did.

But still, in committed relationships, women report wanting sex as often as men do.

If sex is as important to women as they say it is, then why isn't it treated that way? There exists a steady stream of articles and studies about how sex for women remains much less enjoyable than it is for men.

Peggy Orenstein, author of the book "Girls and Sex," writes in the New York Times that sex has become pornified and while women participate, they don't like it.

Anal sex, for example, has become much more commonplace. Orenstein writes, "In 1992, 16 percent of women aged 18 to 24 said they had tried anal sex. Today, according to an Indiana University study, 20 percent of women 18 to 19 have, and by ages 20 to 24 it's up to 40 percent."

The problem is, women seem not to enjoy this new "fifth base" yet do it anyway. Why?

Even when having rather vanilla sex, about 30 percent of women report experiencing pain. That's an extraordinarily high number for an activity that's supposed to be enjoyable and desired.

When we discuss sex not living up to its potential for women, the blame is often placed on the man for being interested in his own sexual outcome more than he is in hers. While men may earn some blame, shouldn't the responsibility for a woman's enjoyment fall on her as well?

Getting men to focus less on their own orgasms is a fairly impossible goal. It's easier, and better for everyone in the long run, to tell women that great sex isn't something someone else can give them; it's something they should make happen themselves.

Sex is the key to a happy marriage. Studies show it, but we don't need studies to know that walking around in an afterglow of good sex can't be a bad thing for a partnership meant to last.

The problem is that while women and men may both desire the same quantity of sex in relationships, the quality of sex is much more important to men than it is for women.

Ask a man what he wants in a woman and he'll always put attractiveness near the top of the list. Women, on the other hand, frequently report things like "steady income" or a "good job."

For a lot of reasons, it makes sense for women to look for stability. But a "good job" does not a hot sex life make. If women want it, they need to prioritize it.

When women hear they should make sex the most important part of their relationship, too many imagine that means that the other things they look for -- stability, sense of humor, good character -- don't matter as much.

But putting sex first on the list doesn't mean the rest of the list disappears. And it doesn't mean you run off and marry the first man who gives you a great orgasm, either.

Men don't imagine that the first girl they have great sex with is the only one they can have great sex with. Why do women?

If women want equality in the bedroom, they have to get it for themselves. If they wait around for a man to de-prioritize his orgasm, they'll likely be waiting a long time.

By putting sex at the top of their priority list in a relationship, women take ownership of their fulfillment and that leads to happiness in other aspects of their relationship and general lives.

Great sex is important; women shouldn't be pretending otherwise.

title: Sincere 60, intelligent, nice guy, ISO Mr Right
text:
No Adonis here, but I don't stop any trains either. 5'11", 280 lbs, bald bellied blue eyed bearish (teddy, not grizzly)

I am (I think, and if I do say so myself), a very nice person, honest, sincere, and loyal. Life has had its bumps along the way, and at 60, I find myself alone, without a whole lot of money, and I would like to find a partner. I never thought I would be posting a CL ad but here it goes.

I'm a nice person, somewhat complicated. I usually mean well, but...
I use my mouth alot - I talk too much, I eat too much, and, well you can help with the other stuff. 
I am a great cook and a lousy housekeeper. I spend too much time indoors and would like to be out more. I like the woods over the beach. I would rather have root canal without anesthesia than sit through the Oscars. Although I am out to everyone in my life who matters, I am not at all into the "gay scene".

My ideal partner is (none of these are absolute requirements except the kissing and cuddling part, and they are not listed in any particular order.) :

A caucasian (white) male between the ages of 45 and 70.
very masculine demeanor, but genuine, not Mary Muscles with leather chaps.
a working man (currently unemployed or retired is o.k.)
comfortable with his sexuality.
friendly and respectful to all.
religious or spiritually oriented, or a tolerant atheist.
a nature lover.
an animal lover.
a guy who can fix things and maybe who can teach me those skills as well.
a kisser and a cuddler (required).
a good listener.
SINGLE and AVAILABLE for building a relationship. (This does not mean that you are in a "long term but sexless relationship" or that you and Evelyn are getting a divorce as soon as you find a new job.)
Horny as Hell with a strong libido, at the *top* of his game but with some versatility. I am NOT looking for a total bottom, or anyone who wants to be "submissive" or who wants a "daddy". 
A non-drug user and a non-alcoholic. (A few beers now and then is fine.)
Generous of spirit.
Someone who doesn't complain about everything. (I dated a NYPD officer once. He was great in many ways, but incessantly harping about his pension. Have a nice life, Sarge.)
Patient.
Vegetarians are nice, but not essential. (I eat very little meat, but I'm not a vegetarian either.)

I really don't care about your bank account, your house in the Bahamas, your stock portfolio, how often you go to the gym, or how many countries you have been to. On the other hand, I might care about the cat you rescued and gave to your niece, the last book you read, the cabin you are building in the Adirondacks, your French lessons, which days you work in the soup kitchen, or what the priest/minister/rabbi's sermon was about.

I don't mind if you are a cigarette smoker, although not in my house, please.

As for looks, etc., I am attracted to faces, but the faces I am attracted to are not necessarily those that others find classically handsome, and I find that most men have something to offer. So if you don't look like George Clooney, don't despair. On the other hand, if you do look like G.C., don't pass me up either! 

I am not particularly attracted to tattoos (they don't turn me off or on - they're just there, and I would never have one). Piercings in odd places DO turn me off, as does "manscaping" and stuff like leather harnesses, etc. Foreskins are nice. I am [literally] allergic to men's cologne.

I suppose I could ramble on and on, but perhaps I have already said too much.

title: Trans for a Gentleman
text:
I will like to meet a nice gentleman for dating. 

Age is not specifically a problem, but I do prefer 45+, college-educated guys in suits. 

Your family status is not important to me.

How to Meet Me 
=======================================

I am amazed by how many people lose track of how the world works once they get "online". I constantly get messages from people who ask something like "how can we meet?" The answer is we meet the same way people meet in normal life: First, you write me a nice letter. Your letter shows you to be charming, interesting, fun, outgoing. You have a photo in your letter. Your letter describes you completely. We exchange a few letters and I become more interested in you. Eventually, you ask me out on a date, and if I like you and your invitation, I accept and we exchange telephone numbers. This is the way the world works, and you should already know it. If you think you are going to skip steps because you have this amazing opinion of yourself, or if you think that the girl (me) is going to ask you out on a date, this is your reality check. Once you remember that this is still real life, you will know what to do.

How to Get a Date With The Girl

Guy 1: "U wanna get together sometime maybe, and do something, and hang out maybe?"

Guy 2: "I would like to take you to the restaurant named 'Italian Delight' for dinner at 8pm, and to the piano bar named 'Tickle my Keys' for jazz, cocktails and conversation afterward at about 10pm."
